workflow.name: Compare LLM token costs across 350+ models with OpenRouter
workflow.description:
###  This n8n template lets you run prompts against 350+ LLM models and see exactly what each request costs with real-time pricing from OpenRouter

  Use cases are many: Compare costs across different models, plan your AI budget, optimize prompts for cost efficiency, or track expenses for client billing!

  ## Good to know

  - OpenRouter charges a platform fee on top of model costs. See [OpenRouter Pricing](https://openrouter.ai/pricing) for details.
  - You need an OpenRouter account with API credits. Free signup available with some free models included.
  - Pricing data is fetched live from OpenRouter's API, so costs are always up-to-date.

  ## How it works

  1. All available models are fetched from OpenRouter's API when you start.
  2. You select a model and enter your prompt via the form (or just use the chat).
  3. The prompt is sent to OpenRouter and the response is captured.
  4. Token usage (input/output) is extracted from the response using a LangChain Code node.
  5. Real-time pricing for your selected model is fetched from OpenRouter.
  6. The exact cost is calculated and displayed alongside your AI response.

  ## How to use

  - **Chat interface**: Quick testing - just type a prompt and get the response with costs.
  - **Form interface**: Select from all available models via dropdown, enter your prompt, and get a detailed cost breakdown.
  - Click **"Show Details"** on the result form to see the full breakdown (input tokens, output tokens, cost per type).

  ## Requirements

  - OpenRouter account with API key ([Get one here](https://openrouter.ai/settings/keys))

  ## Customising this workflow

  - Add a database node to log all requests and costs over time
  - Connect to Google Sheets for cost tracking and reporting
  - Extend with LLM-as-Judge evaluation to also check response quality

---

*{{ $json.model.name }} ¬∑ Prompt ${{ $json.model.prompt_price_per_token.toFixed(7) }}/tk ¬∑ Completion ${{ $json.model.completion_price_per_token.toFixed(7) }}/tk*

parameters.formDescription:
üîç Find out exactly what your AI requests cost.

  This tool lets you:
  ‚Ä¢ Choose from 350+ LLM models (GPT-4, Claude, Llama, etc.)
  ‚Ä¢ Enter any prompt and run it
  ‚Ä¢ See the exact token usage and cost breakdown

  Perfect for comparing model prices or tracking your AI spending

parameters.content:
# LLM Token Cost Tracker
  üîç **Find out exactly what your AI requests cost.**
  ---
  ## ‚ú® Features
  - **350+ Models** - Access GPT-4, Claude, Llama, Mistral, and many more
  - **Real-time Pricing** - Costs calculated using live OpenRouter pricing data
  - **Detailed Breakdown** - See input tokens, output tokens, and cost per category
  - **Two Interfaces** - Use via Chat or interactive Form
  ---
  ## üõ†Ô∏è Setup
  ### 1. Get your OpenRouter API Key
  1. Visit [OpenRouter API Keys](https://openrouter.ai/settings/keys)
  2. Click **"Create Key"**
  3. Copy your new API key

  ### 2. Configure the HTTP Node
  1. Open the **HTTP Request** node (fetches model list)
  2. In the **Authentication** dropdown, select **"Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE"**
  3. Click **"Create New Credential"**
  4. Paste your API key and save

  ### 3. Configure the OpenRouter Chat Model
  1. Open the **OpenRouter Chat Model** node (attached to the LangChain Code node)
  2. Click **"Create New Credential"**
  3. Paste the same API key and save

  ‚úÖ **Done!** Your workflow is ready to use.
  ---

  ## üöÄ Usage
  ### Option 1: Chat Interface
  The quickest way to test:

  1. Open the **Chat** panel in n8n
  2. Type any prompt
  3. Get your response + cost breakdown directly in the chat

  ### Option 2: Form Interface
  For model selection and detailed results:

  1. Click **"Form Submission"** ‚Üí **"Start"**
  2. Wait a moment while all available models are fetched from OpenRouter
  3. **Select a model** from the dropdown (e.g., `openai/gpt-4.1-mini`)
  4. **Enter your prompt** in the textarea
  5. Click **"Submit"**
  6. View the **result form** with:
     - The AI response
     - Total cost
     - Click **"Show Details"** for full breakdown:
       - Input tokens
       - Output tokens
       - Cost per token type
       - Model pricing info

  ---
  ## üí° Use Cases
  - **Compare model costs** - Same prompt, different models, see price differences
  - **Budget planning** - Estimate costs before scaling up
  - **Optimize prompts** - See how prompt length affects cost
  - **Client billing** - Track exact costs per request
  ---
  ## üîó Links
  - [OpenRouter](https://openrouter.ai/) - Multi-model API gateway
  - [OpenRouter Pricing](https://openrouter.ai/models) - Current model prices
  - [Get API Key](https://openrouter.ai/settings/keys) - Create your key here

  ---
  Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by philflow for the n8n community
  ---

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
